intro: Dalea emphysodes subsp. thyrsiflora, commonly known as the bracted milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
